alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 10:16PM CST until February 01 at 10:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Austin, Fort Bend, Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...From this evening to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...Additional runoff upstream will cause the river to rise back above flood stage later tonight and crest around 17.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 10/30/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 16.8 Mon 6 pm CST 17.5 16.1 14.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
